Reviews.Title: “Great deal in midtown Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: NanjingBob
Reviews.Content: Woogo, aka Central Park Apartments, is the best deal I have found in NYC. It's a prime location in the heart of midtown, and next to a subway station, for an extremely modest price. Although definitely not fancy, this basic facility provides a fully furnished one bedroom apartment with a sofabed in the living room for barely over $100 per night. It's certainly modest, but very clean and safe. My last stay with them, the sofabed was not really usable, because of a terrible mattress, but they apologized,offering a foam mattress pad and explaining that the sofas were already scheduled for replacement. If you are looking for a Hyatt, forget it, but if you want simple, clean, roomy accommodations at a bargain price, this is it. I have stayed with them multiple times and have never been disappointed. Note that my "sleep quality rating" was based on the double bed, not the sleeper sofa, which would have been a '1'. Also, the bed was perfectly comfortable, but I reserve '5' for the 4 or 5 star hotels with luxury pillows & mattresses.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy room, inept Manager (Carlos). STAY CLEAR OF THIS PLACE!”
Reviews.Author: AronMilano
Reviews.Content: When we got in our room at The Times Square Palace on West 43rd at 5:45pm, the place was very filthy (hairs all over, cigarette butts, dust, etc.) and the bed was not made. The man downstairs sent us a hosekeeper who said she wasn't working there and she just dropped off three towels (which we soon found out were dirty,too), telling us that we had to make our own beds. A friend of us living in NYC called the property Management in NYC at 212-6168497, and after being disconnected while speaking with Dan, he spoke with Carlos, who put him on hold for over ten minutes. He called back and spoke with Scott, who said Carlos wasn't availabe; however, Scott assured that the room would be made right away. We left and when we came back at 11:30pm, the room was still filthy and unmade. We were offered to take a cab (at our exepense) and go to another apartment on 73rd Street, which we declined, because it was late, we were exhasuted and we feared that that place might be just as dirty. This morning our friend Marco called Carlos, who said he was still investigating this matter (he shouldn't apply for a job at the local Police station, I would say). I asked him what investigation he had been making and he told me that he wanted to speak with the people at the Times Square "Palace" (no name was ever more fitting). When Marco let him know that we were leaving in a few minutes, and that we expected a full refund, he said he would call back in a few minutes, which he didnt. Marco persisted and called back, only to hear Carlos say the "investigation" had produced the following result: the housekeeper said that she has cleaned the room and therefore there was no refund. Since no one had bothered to come and check the condition of the room when we complained, we feel we were treated as liars not worthy of any help and we strongly believe that a lazy and incompetent man like Carlos should not be working in the hotel business.

Reviews.Title: “73rd st apartments, great price great location”
Reviews.Author: neashley
Reviews.Content: My 12 year old daughter and I stayed at the Woogo Ap's on 73rd st rm 1408. So it was just the 2 of us. We only stayed about 4 nights. The place was a little small but really nice. There wasn't much a a view. It had a full bed and a love seat with a kitchenette, microwave, small table for 2 and small fridge. The bed was really comfortable. It also had a small walk in closet and nice bathroom. The place was clean. I didn't have any problems the other reviewers are talking about but maybe that is just the Time Square location? They are located on the upper west side. There is also the 72nd M station where you can take the 1 2 or 3. Thee amazing Fairway Market is across the street on the same side if you want to do some grocery shopping to eat in. I recommend Beacon Wine and Spirits for a great selection of wine. They are across from Fairway Markets. It was a close walk to Central Park 10-15 min maybe? Also you can grab a hot dog at the famous Gray's Papaya across the street. The only thing I would say I didn't like is we went in March and it was freezing and they kept the apartment too warm. There was no way to adjust the heat so we had to run the air conditioner or else it would've been what felt like 85 in our room. Other then that our stay was great.

Reviews.Title: “woogo ruined my new year... rat infested..”
Reviews.Author: socialgirl
Reviews.Content: I booked an apartment for my family and when we arrived they informed us they overbooked. because it was new years there were no rooms available anywhere. thay put us in one of their apartments in a building i had never stayed at. it was not only smelly and dirty , but it was rat infested. there were mice running around freely in the kitchen area. and there was one on the window next to the bed. When i went to the lobby to complain and to asked to be moved . the little indian man who was in charge said to me what do you expect you are in new York. he opended his coat jacket and handed me a sticky trap and told me that when the mouse was stuck to call him.. obviously we were in shock and tried to find another hotel on our own. we didn t have much luck. so we basicely didnt sleep. I contacted woogo main office. to complain and at the least get my money back. it took me a few months just to get a response and finally 6 months or more later they offered me a refund by check. 2 years later im still waiting for check .with several attempts an inquiries.. ive given up..

Reviews.Title: “SCAMMED!!!”
Reviews.Author: sperez422
Reviews.Content: This company will show you photo's of places they don't rent out. The scammed us and gave us a room dirty, dishes in the sink an made us wait from 7a to 330p for a cleaning person to come. The room was nothing like the pictures they sent us. No cable to watch tv no internet to purchase. Stay away. I am suing them and if anyone wants to join let me know

Reviews.Title: “Anybody there?”
Reviews.Author: napany
Reviews.Content: The only one cleaning girl does not speak English. The 24 hours phone number doesn't bother calling back. Too bad if the "guests" upstairs are fighting the third world war at midnight!! The "complementary cleaning" after 5 days................Have you seen it? Clean towels? Are you kidding? The cleaning girl is too busy to change them every day. The location is great, but the holes in the bed linen even grater. Did I mention that the microwawe doesn't work? At least I assume so because my dinner was still frozen after 10 minutes. Please book a room here if you are looking to improve your patience!

Reviews.Title: “SCAM! do not go to this PLACE”
Reviews.Author: Bobright
Reviews.Content: My partner and i booked to stay at this so called "TRENDY" central apartments in New York for two nights in April of this year for what was to be the end of a lovely holiday together. On arrival at reception we were told a $100 would be charged to my credit card in the event that we would use the bar.... it gets better! This never happens at any decent establishment, your card details would be taken but not charged. On arrival into our "ROOM" as this was not an apartment nor studio as advertised our faces dropped at the total daylight robbery that had taken place. The room was filthy, the mattress dirty with huge lumps in various parts, the ceiling had stains from damp, the air con did`nt work and the room was as hot as hell, oh! and the "Bar" consisted of soda`s (five or six at most and water) even at the Regis this would not amount to $100. Going into the bathroom there was a smell of stale urine, at this point i went to the reception and asked for a room change. The new room was a tad better with about just enough room to swing a cat. There was less of an aroma in the bathroom, but it had a pipe running through that made it terribly hot. On our second morning the toilet overflowed and the shower broke, it took forever to get sorted, i had to physically go downstairs to get somebody to come and sort the flood out. The receptionist had turned his nose up at my request but luckily a manager of some sort was passing through and over heard and ordered immediate action much to my delight. This unfortunately was a rather disappointing experience and very misleading advert. I urge you to spend a bit more and get what you pay for, this was daylight robbery in my books..... Never again..... Unfortunately i did`nt take pictures of the "REAL" Woo Goo.

Reviews.Title: “SWEET SIXTEEN FANTASY”
Reviews.Author: yolandy
Reviews.Content: WOO GOO TIMES SQUARE WAS GREAT!!!!! If you are accustomed to luxury, this is not your place. If you want to experience NEW YORK--NEW YORK STYLE---Come and get it. I We booked site unseen. We were very anxious because you do have to prepay---however we were staying for a week. It was my daughter's 16th birthday and we KICKED IT WELL. IT is in the heart of the square. Good morning America on one corner-ESPN on the other--Toys R US on the other and BUBBA GUMPS restaurant on the other which was awesome. YES it is an old apartment. Yes bring your own bedding. Yes there is a market about 5 blocks you can buy food because you do have a kitchen. Just a kitchen--fridge,stove, sink,dishes,water--the basics. Did you come to NEW YORK to stay in your room?It's spacious. NOT a ONE room hotel-REAL SPACE. We stayed in the 3 bedroom first--because our 2 bedroom WAS overbooked but they accomodated. THERE IS NO HOTEL STAFF!!! WHO CARES!! NO TIPS NEEDED!! YOU are in an APARTMENT 700 bucks we paid for a week!!!!! WE were on 106 and park show-free--went to see COLOR PURPLE 130.00 bucks-went to Empire state buildng 30 bucks--ground zero 2.00 we caught the subway!!!!!! we were on goodmorning america everyday--free!!!! The Today Show was at the Olympics but we still visited NBC studios. There is a cool barbecue joint acrooss the street that stays open late. Next door is a hotel that has all the fashion shows--we learned this too late but we saw glam glam!! All these places we walked--except for the play because we dressed up--but DON"T. Dress up in NEW YORK is FUR COAT and jeans. Cabs are plenty!!!! We went to JUNIORS the cheesecake place in brooklyn--THE doorman took us on his day off---WE HAD A BALL!!! I am on here today tring to plan NEW YEARS EVE AT THIS VERY SPOT!!! Think your first apartment with the bare necessities--but we brought our stuff with us because we're chicks anyway--so air freshner, plug ins and candles we travel with anyway--IT'S AN APARTMENT you make IT A HOME. ENJOY!! WOO GOO TIMES SQUARE!!!!OH yeah all the shops are walking distance--MACY'S,VS,Purses, shoes, jeans,food --you name it---waalk walk walk

Reviews.Title: “Needs serious overhaul, bring cleaning supplies! Better Business Bureau says NO!”
Reviews.Author: UWS_Gremlin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with family - last minute cancellation of other apt. Ended up buying supplies accross the road to clean the apartment from top to bottom (if your apt is clean - likely it was my doing!), replacing broken lights, etc. Bought new sheets & towels (staying for the week). Location is great, wish Woogo had more passion for the hospitality business! Their uptown location (Central Park) is a much better choice, Similar issues with the linens and towels, bring your own if you are picky... Or if you need an apt, consider the Milburn on 76th Street? One thing I do need to share is the Better Business Bureau writeup of this place - caveat emptor! Book thru Hotels.com - at least they allow you to cancel should you need to... "Complaints to the BBB report that hotels operated by Woogo are often in poor condition, exposing consumers to mice, mold, dirty linens, and filthy rooms. One consumer reported that she was trapped in her room for an hour and half when the door knob to her room broke. Consumers also allege that the rooms and amenities are not what was described to them on woogo.com and that they have great difficulty obtaining a refund when they discover the true state of their room. Complaints to the BBB also include instances of Woogo over-charging consumers' credit cards and not honoring discounts. Customer Experience this business has an unsatisfactory record with the Bureau, because there is a pattern of complaints, and the business has not corrected the underlying reason for the complaints." Just so you know! Woogo does actually have some dedicated staff - some are quite committed (and they travel from location to location, too)

Reviews.Title: “What's all the fuss about??”
Reviews.Author: WestCumbrianLass
Reviews.Content: I've just read other reviews and feel like I have to say my piece. My family and I (me, hubby, then 3yr old son, and my 63/65 yr old parents) stayed at Woogo apt on W53/8th Ave over Xmas n New Year 2006. We had a 2 bed apt which was EXACTLY like the pics on the website. I booked it almost 12 months in advance and all they took from me was $100 deposit. The balance was paid on arrival - after I checked the apt. Woogo was recommended to me by a friend of my brother , who had stayed at the Lincoln Centre apts and thought highly of them. It was clean, tidy, with a stocked fridge, tinned food on the counter top (all in date) and great views over the Hudson. We arrived 3 hours late, after 10pm and I was panicking abit, but no fear. The manager had left our details at the front desk and our key was awaiting us. Yes, the office on floor 14 was like a bombsite, but staff were reasonably helpful. They arranged our transfer back to the airport. And we could leave our luggage in the office (along with many, many others!) on our last day. Having stayed in New York hotels on several occasions, I would recommend the Woogo apt to families who want space - if you've ever been cooped up in a hotel room with a hyper toddler you'll know what I'm talking about!! we had ample space and the living room was great for my son to play in (just move the glass table out of the way) and equally great for grandparents to relax in while babysitting without having to be in the same room as child. TV, phone and all equipment worked. We have just returned from yet another trip to NY and this time stayed in Novotel (as apt being converted and my first choice Belvedere not available - great hotel, stayed there 3 times) and we all agreed that apt living was infinitely better than a hotel room. I do believe these apts are no longer in use unfortunately, being converted into condos. At the end of the day, you get what you pay for. If you want luxury then pay the prices. If you pay budget prices then please don't complain because your bedroom/bathroom is small and you don't have access to all mod-cons.

Reviews.Title: “No Go to the WooGo!”
Reviews.Author: kiwifamily2a2c
Reviews.Content: I would definitely not recommend this hotel. We had booked 2x 2 bedroom rooms and when we got there we had to wait for a long time because there was a double booking with our rooms. The whole hotel looked old and was of very poor quality and in need of a lot of renovations. The kitchen had unusable filthy crockery and the suite was dusty and smelly. The beds were extremely uncomfortable too. The doors jammed often, electrical plugs hung from sockets, the bathroom taps came off in your hand, the shower curtain was filthy and we saw a huge rat run across the room - we tried to trap it under the filthy oven in the kitchen, but the manager wasnâ€™t interested and didnâ€™t even own any mouse traps, although other people complained about them as well. It was such a shame because it is in a great location in Times Square but the accommodation was almost unbearable. Letâ€™s just say No Go to the Woogo Hotel, itâ€™s as bad as itâ€™s name sounds. Had there been any other beds in New York for the 2 nights we needed, we would definitely have moved.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for NYC”
Reviews.Author: MikeColorado
Reviews.Content: My guess is that any one who writes a negative review of this hotel is used to staying at only the nicest hotels available. I am sure I could find a scuff on the wall or some peeling paint to complain about, but I think there are far more interesting things in Manhattan to think about! The hotel is a excellent value. You will be hard pressed to find any thing comprable for under $200.00 per night. It is right next to the 72nd St metro station and is comfortable. If you have any experience traveling in Europe you will most likely find these hotel rooms spacious and nictely appointed by compairison.

Reviews.Title: “Caution - Beware do not book !!! Fraud”
Reviews.Author: djmick
Reviews.Content: We had booked to stay 1 week. Upon arrival the place was filthy, wires exposed.. and staff were very unhelpful. The actual room was dirty, no blinds, no proper beds or duvuts...smelt like a wet mop bucket and had paint peeling. These guys should be shut down !! what they are doing in wrong and they are runing people holidays !! We didn't stay long but they took 500$ without authorisatiuon. We expressed this to WOO GOO and they still did it. To date all e-mail are gone unanswered and we still have no money ! These guys are CROOKS !!!!!!! I just hope this review stops someone having holidays ruined. Wesite totally misleading ..Do not be fooled !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “woogo apartments - would NOT advise staying there”
Reviews.Author: familyturner
Reviews.Content: Strongly advise against booking an apartment with Woogo, New York. We booked 2 apartments. Both apartments had cockroaches, one of the apartments a small rat was seen in kitchen area. On complaining, Woogo did nothing, we resorted to all people staying in one apartment as those in the rat apartment were not happy staying there. Both apartments should have been for 6 people in each. one of the apartments had a sofa bed in another bedroom, meaning that 4 adults had to sleep in one room - not how it was advertised. On complaining we were offered 25% off our next booking! Certainly would not book with them again and would strongly advise others not to book with Woogo.

Reviews.Title: “Beware - not a trustworthy operator”
Reviews.Author: OnTheRoadAgain-NY
Reviews.Content: Booked an apartment with Woogo in Ny, which was advertised as a 5* property. Paid in advance, but when we arrived, the accommodations (and the quality of the building) was definitely NOT how it was advertised. Called Woogo customer service (woman called Lea), who admitted to the lower quality of the accommodations, and agreed (in writting) to a 25% refund. It has been 4 months since, and despite the written confirmation, the refund has not been sent. Unless you get a really good discount, don't stay with Woogo-managed properties.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected! Good location”
Reviews.Author: Lauraloo100
Reviews.Content: Myself and 3 friends recently stayed at the Woo go apartments MIDTOWN which are close to times square. After reading the reviews we were a bit wary of what we would find but decided to give it a go anyway. Check-in - a bit confusing but i had my printed confirmation to hand. Staff not very friendly but not the worst service. We wanted to check the room out first and the lady was happy to let us do that before checking in and exchanging money First impressions - building looks like a normal residential building from outside and lobby is clean and pleasant and has a warden. Some of the floors of this building are disgusting but from what we found are not those used by Woo go. There are other companies and privately owned apartments in this building. Apartment - 2 bed. We were on 22nd Floor. It was almost identical to picture on Woo go website and discription correct. New radio/ cd player and a cable television. We had a good view from both windows, although not of any major sites. Not enough lighting (only lamps in all rooms except bathroom) and bath room could do with a refurb but otherwise clean and in order. Master bedroom is of a good size and has walk in wardrobe. Small double bedroom a bit tight and most of storage space in wardrobes outside bedroom. Basic Kitchen with some useful utensils. Location - it is about a 10min walk to Times Square and about 10-15min walk the opposite direction to Central Park. About 5-10 min walk to theatre distrcit which is on the way to Times Square. Bagel Bar underneath hotel that does all sort of sandwich type refreshments. It opens about 530-6am an doesn't close till early evening. Lots of cafes around for food, convenience store across the road with good toiletries and household goods but minimal refreshments. It easy to hail taxi's on 8th Avenue. Overall - In my opinion we got what we paid for, we received what the description told us and we were happy with it and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “woogo Rip off”
Reviews.Author: vito54
Reviews.Content: Booked with woogo. They stole my money upon check in. Gave me the wrong type of room, Hotel and room was filthy. I wanted a refund immediatly, they refused and said I could get my money back by applying on the internet. Beware!! This organization is very bad. Do not stay at any of their properties.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jondavi
Reviews.Content: Disgusting in every sense of the word. From obnoxious check in personnel, to sewer like bathrooms and rooms. Stay as far away as possible. They should condemn this place and send the management to prison.

Reviews.Title: “Woogo Is Terrible!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mrkt
Reviews.Content: I booked a reservation but had to cancel it. It's been almost 6 months, and I HAVE NOT RECEIVED MY REFUND. DO NOT BOOK WITH THEM!!! At the time, they honored a full refund policy, but I have been getting the run around for months. I called and emailed but all I ever get is, "They are processing your request."...blah blah. I filed a claim with my credit card company and have also reported them to the Better Business Bureau (BBB) for the UK. DO NOT GIVE THIS COMPANY ANY BUSINESS!!!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT BOOK WOOGO, YOU WILL BE SORRY!!”
Reviews.Author: Pony_Malony
Reviews.Content: When we were looking for an appartment in New York, we found a number of places on the internet. Woogo seemed to be OK, so we booked in with them for a week at 244 W 64th Street. What a mistake!! There were so many things wrong, I feel like I have been robbed!! The staff are incredibly rude and unhelpfull. What's more, the appartment was NOTHING like the picture on their website and not in a great area. When calling customer care to make an enquiry, they were even worse!! Unbelievable that a company this bad can continue to be in business. My advice would be to NOT USE WOOGO. You really don't need the bad experience on your holiday!!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but for the customer service!”
Reviews.Author: extra_leg_room
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Midtown apartment for 4 nights in March 2006, after experiencing two months of some of the worst customer service I have ever had the misfortune to encounter. My $100 holding deposit was taken out of my bank account 5 times in 'error'. It took me weeks to get it back (after they told me they had refunded it, when clearly they hadn't), and the clueless people manning the phones in customer service were of absolutely no help. My booking was cancelled twice, then rebooked, all through the incompetence of the staff based at the call centre. It was sorted eventually, but not until spending hours on the phone to them. Me and my girlfriend arrived late (midnight) and the concierge seemed to have little clue as to where we were meant to be staying, but we eventually got shown to our room. We stayed with two other friends in a 2 bed apartment on the 52 floor. Basic, but tastefully furnished. We had amazing panoramic views over the city. It is a great location, with only a couple of minutes walk to Broadway and Times Square. If you are just looking for somewhere to sleep and use as a base it is ideal- It cost us around $50 per night per person which I felt was good value. The TV and stereo were good- and made a nice change from staying in a hotel. Spacious enough, comfy beds, and VERY warm heating (not sure what it would be like in Summer). If it weren't for the awful customer service, I would rate this place higher. If you can get over that, then there could be worse places to stay. (If the building is still standing that is- the permanent smell of gas in our room made me think it was going to explode at any moment.........)

Reviews.Title: “Not good with the finances”
Reviews.Author: female_wanderer
Reviews.Content: I didn't get to actually stay at these apartments. My problems with them were purely financial. I reserved these apartments; when they made the reservation, they charged $500 to my credit card immediately as a deposit on one apartment, then the entire rate, $1900, to my card for the second apartment. I had to cancel my stay with them, and got a notice that it might take more than 21 working days to refund my money. After waiting the 21 days and seeing no refund, I wrote them and said that if i didn't see the refund immediately, I would be calling my credit card and putting a fraud alert on the charge and have the charge revoked. I did get the $1900 refunded almost right away, but have yet to see the $500. i think it is a scam that they charge you that much just to make the reservation; they then keep it for a while so they can probably collect the interest off of it.

Reviews.Title: “Beware...Uge Scam..Worst Experience of My Life”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: WHAT A HORROR story. we checked in for a weeks stay 2/5/06, around 10 pm of the night we checked in a notice was slid under the door that woogo had surrendered all 110 rooms that they had in the Herald Towers. The notice was stamped by a notary, and said that if we continued to occupy the room after 5pm on 2/6/06 that we would be trespassing. As soon as the Woogo office opened in the morning I went down there...along with About 100 other people, and was told that it was a scam, not to worry. When we returned to the room around 4 pm the manager of the Herald Towers took us into his office, and explained that Woogo had indeed surrendered the rooms, as they were subletting for periods of less than 30 days, and that violated the agreement that they had w/ The Herald Towers. I again contacted the Woogo office, and Travel Now who I had booked through. Oscar, the Woogo rep came up to our room, told us not to leave it was a "scam", and that he Would be back in about 10 minutes. In the mean time a representative of the Herald Towers arrived at our room with a New York City police officer who escorted us out of the building. The gentleman did give us a $20 bill for a cab. My god...my co worker and I felt like a cheap prostitute!!!!. Woogo is a HUGE sacm....we paid for a weeks reservation, and were literally thrown out on the street in New York, as were at least the occupants of the other 109 rooms. BEWARE..this was the worst, and most humiliating experience of my life!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not What They Advertise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked a week at WooGo on 63st. but when I got there, they said my reservations weren't there. only to make me wait half an hour before telling me they had found it. when I finally got to my room, I was appalled by the vast comaprison it had to the description they gave online. not only were the blankets and towels dirty, but the pillow still had hairs on them. To make matters worse, I found roaches in the kitchen area. The dishes looked like they had just been used and were still wet in the dishwasher, when I asked for some dish wash detergent, they said they had none. (Which made me wonder what it was washed with in the first place.) The service was horrible! No one seemed to be willing to help, they didnt seem to care as long as you fill the form out. Overall, it was truly disgusting!

Reviews.Title: “You have an apartment, NOT”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After arriving in New York City for a first time visit. We found an apartment building in shambles with not apartments available to be livable. We are awaiting a suppossed reimbursement. Do not Use WooGo.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but...”
Reviews.Author: Ritter
Reviews.Content: On the day the record snow storm hit New York I checked into the WooGo Apartments on 53rd Street New York advertised as Midtown by WooGo. We stayed one week in February 2006. Having made my way to the 14th Floor of this apartment block to the WooGo office (office=untidy apartment rooms) I was given the keys to a 7th Floor apartment. On walking in our faces dropped. It lacked any sort of wow factor. But the place grew on us and we were very comfortable there. It was a spacious two bed apartment with a living room with a sofa bed. Four of us stayed there and it never felt crowded. Plenty of cupboard space. The bathroom felt old (the building is old come to think of it). It looked old and tired but perfectly adequate. No more than that though. The kitchenette was ok for making cuos of tea or coffee or for getting a drink from the fridge. In New York you will not want to be cooking for yourself so the kitchen was not needed but if it was then...no. The apartment was heated. Too well heated. I never thought I would use air-con to cool a room in Winter (the windows are sealed and don't open). We felt safe there. The doors had double locks. There was a concierge at ground floor. The place is very conveniently situated on the corner of 53rd and 8th Avenue. It is less than 5 minutes walk to Broadway and about another 5 minutes to Times Square. The people who work for WooGo are friendly and accommodating. If I have a criticism they promise more than they can deliver. Could they get me a taxi to the airport. No. But there are plenty passing by outside anyway. I give it a three star rating (2.5 star really).

Reviews.Title: “Don't trust WooGo management. You will be sorry.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: You are a fool if you trust these guys. We booked an apartment two months before our convention, close to Javits Center, and reconfirmed the reservation two days before we arrived. Then we arrived, only to be told that a "computer glitch" had double booked our apartment, and that we had to be relocated 40 blocks north. So instead of five blocks from our convention, we were 40+ blocks away. Then the blizzard of 2006 hit, and we couldn't get back and forth from the convention hall. It was a complete nightmare. WooGo management are truly the ambassadors of despair. Don't say you weren't warned.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my apartment.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Times Square location. At first all of the consruction and renovations had us a little scared. Once we arrived at our room we were very happy with the one bedroom apartment. It actually felt like a home away from home, and we were right near everything we needed to visit. The only one problem I had was that it was a little cold, other than that I would stay again and again.

Reviews.Title: “if it sounds too good to be true.....”
Reviews.Author: hgp
Reviews.Content: The "apartment" was 150 sq ft. total with no seperate living area. No couch. Our room was basically clean, although it had construction "residue" along edges and corners and a very strong amonia cleaner smell that never went away. 2 burner stove top, no pots or pans (just potholders!). Fridge under burners where the door kept swinging open due to the slant in the floor. Small table, but useless as it held the microwave. DIshes were not microwave safe (lots of sparks). Coffee pot - no filters. Small night stand which held the TV. No where to put ANYTHING except the floor. No heat control, room was HOT so we slept with the window (no screen) open. Sheets were clean but so thin you could see the uncovered mattress. Mattress too small for the frame. I called ahead to let them know we would be later (12pm) but it took us 45 minutes to find someone to give us keys. All the doors were locked and no one was around. We stood outside knocking...not much fun. I never did find the exercise room. There is no lobby. For the money (we paid less than 100 a night) I don't think you can do better-we at least had a private bathroom. You just can't expect it to be anything like the pictures or what is advertised. Don't plan to lounge around in your "apartment" because we had to sit on the bed and step over all our stuff to get to the door. It was very small. Area is safe, location great, and our neighbor was nice. We are pretty good at rolling with the punches and just laughed and had a good time anyway. I can see though how it would be easy to have a really bad experiance so we will not stay there again. I have a problem with any company that mis-represents itself on such a large scale. They would do better to simply be honest. I have included pictures taken from every angle around the room. I also added a couple of pics after we had been there a few days so you could see how cluttered it got!

HotelInfo.Name: Woogo Apartments - Times Square
HotelInfo.Address: 123 West 44th Street, New York City, NY
